channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report E-2024010521
item.description:
Report E-2024010521

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a result of improper loading/inadequate preparation for transportation, a 15DM containing Isopropanol became crushed and leaked approximately 0.5 gallons onto a 1'x1' area of the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor stated that the released material evaporated by the time they responded to the release. The damaged drum was moved to the waste area for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024010703
item.description:
Report X-2024010703

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010703 THE LEAKING CLASS 8 HAZMAT WAS RESPONDED TO BY RESPONDER IN DOOR 216 AND RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. ALL MERCHANDISE WAS DAMAGED BY THE SPILL AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP AS A LIQUID. 2. X-2024010704 THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS THEN DISPATCHED TO THE LOCATION OF THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. THE DR THEN CONTAINERIZED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND TRANSPORTED IT BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ONCE AT THE PSC THE DR FOLLOWED THE DAMAGED MATERIALS PROCESS TO DISPOSE OF THE LEAKING HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2024010526
item.description:
Report X-2024010526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-15
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THE IRREG BELT NEAR DOOR 15. UNLOADER PULLED IT OFF THE BELT WHERE HE SAW IT WAS LEAKING. RESPONDER DONNED THE APPROPRIATE PPE ON THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONDED TO THE CALL.

item.title: Report X-2024010639
item.description:
Report X-2024010639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box arrived at qa and once outer box was opened, it was clear that the leak was caused by a loose closure. The twist cap on one of the botles was completely off. DescribePack: Cap was unattached from bottle and over half of the liquid had leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The cap was reattached and tightened.
